Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of warrior moving right, seemingly turned back (body, right thigh, all but foot of advanced left leg with greave remaining; added red on lower part of short chiton and possibly on greave), carrying shield (added white face, worn with no device preserved); trace of black line at bottom of sherd.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix "9" was added by the British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from the other 1912.37 sherds.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0691) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
